content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 35$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 35$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 40$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

As a human player, I would reason that the game seems to favor picking R over B because of the higher payoff (45$ vs 35$) when my opponent chooses B and I choose R. However, there's a catch: if I pick R every time, I will never get the 0$ payout that I can get when I pick B.

In this game, picking R gives me higher potential winnings in one scenario (when my opponent picks B), but also exposes me to lower winnings or even no winnings at all if my opponent also chooses R. Picking B ensures a consistent 40$ payout each round and a possible 35$ bonus if my opponent picks R, although I miss out on the 0$ payouts when they pick R as well.

In the long run of 75 rounds, it seems that picking R might be riskier because it offers fewer guaranteed winnings compared to picking B. However, since this is an anonymous player and there's no way for me to know their strategy, I cannot be certain if they will consistently pick R or B.

Given the uncertainty about my opponent's strategy, I would likely opt for a mixed strategy to maximize my expected payoff and reduce risk. In other words, I might choose R more often in the first half of the game (to potentially gain higher winnings) and switch to picking B more frequently later on (to secure consistent earnings).

Thus, as a human player, my choice would be to randomly pick either R or B with some probability greater than 0 but less than 1 for each round. This decision ensures that I have a chance at earning the higher potential payouts while also securing some guaranteed winnings and minimizing risk over the course of the game.

You chose B. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 35$. Your opponent's payoff is 0$. Please play the next round.

In this particular round, I chose B while my opponent picked R. This means that I earned 35$ while they got nothing. Now that I know my opponent picked R in the previous round, I might adjust my strategy for the next round based on the information I have about their choice. However, it's important to remember that this is a one-time event and doesn't necessarily reflect what my opponent will do in future rounds since they are anonymous and may not be consistent in their choices.

Given this new piece of information, I might consider choosing R for the next round, as it offers me a higher payoff when my opponent picks B. But at the same time, I should remember that if my opponent consistently picks R, I will miss out on 0$ payouts and potentially earn less overall compared to a mixed strategy.

In summary, although knowing my opponent's choice in this one round provides some insight into their strategy, it does not give me enough information to reliably predict or exploit their future choices due to the uncertainty involved in this game with an anonymous player. I would likely continue employing a mixed strategy to maximize my expected payoff and minimize risk over the course of the 75 rounds.

Since my opponent picked B in the previous round and I missed out on the 0$ payout, I might consider choosing B for the next round as it ensures a guaranteed 40$ payout regardless of my opponent's choice. However, if I consistently pick B and my opponent picks R more often, I could potentially miss out on higher payouts (45$) in future rounds.

On the other hand, I might also consider choosing R again in the next round to try and earn the 45$ payout if my opponent continues to choose B. In summary, although knowing my opponent's choice in this one round provides some insight into their strategy, it does not give me enough information to reliably predict or exploit their future choices due to the uncertainty involved in this game with an anonymous player.
